tweets.text:
We‚Äôre pleased to announce that Dr Stewart Davies, Ines Faden da Silva, and Lilli Matson have been appointed to our board.

Their skills and knowledge will help us better prepare the country for climate shocks and deliver on the Government‚Äôs 10-point plan.

https://t.co/DAy02oXx2h

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency So why doesn't the PM stop houses being built on at-risk areas?
The @EnvAgency does a great deal of excellent work, especially for flooding. But #sewage in our rivers is a disgrace and needs fixing.

tweets.text: We are looking for flood wardens & members of flood groups across Yorkshire to take part in our communicating flood risk project. This would involve a 1 hour zoom call with the project team. Please get in touch if you would like to be involved! #floods #floodaware #floodwarden https://t.co/UobxLMVjOh
The Environment Agency have signed up to the #PlantCharter to #reduce GHG emissions and improve #airquality. ‚úÖüëè Welcome @EnvAgency https://t.co/eu8rW70G1G https://t.co/fwDvUDzUl2
@lanmijo @LDV_NNR @Team4Nature @365DaysWild @EnvAgencyYNE Any sign of it abating Lana? Dropped quite a lot on the Ouse today, but I suspect it will be back up after yesterday's snow...

#NSIPs21 is coming up! Hear from @BurgesSalmon @TQ_Solutions @EnvAgency @BDBpitmans @PINSgov @countercontext @mhclg & @NaturalEngland 

Hear about ways to successfully obtain a DCO.

Find out more: https://t.co/DoxEzE0mVD https://t.co/1mVbwZ1Bmn

The levels on the River Thames are still high. This photo shows the areas most affected. There are now 20 flood warnings and 38 flood alerts across our #Thames area. Please stay safe at home if you can. Check your flood risk at https://t.co/64gyL62UXF. https://t.co/A3m1iflgrp

Don't drive through flood water!  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¬æ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it
@SurreyCouncil https://t.co/akYyRv35XV

urls.title: Your weekly digest of climate and environment news from Imperial
urls.description: Cutting carbon is a priority, but a new briefing by climate experts suggest universities and college s must decide how to treat ‚Äòunavoidable‚Äô emissions. The paper provides guidelines for universities and colleges considering offsetting their emissions. Co-author Dr Neil Jennings, Partnership Development Manager at the Grantham Institute, said: "Following these guidelines will help to maximise the chance that offsets are of a high quality and don‚Äôt have any negative social or environmental impacts." This

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency has added 3 new members to its board including @imperialcollege graduate Lilli Matson, Chief Safety, Health & #Environment Officer at @TfL where they are "working to achieve our ambition of Vision Zero" 
Read more in our weekly digest: https://t.co/Uuyy4tSIAF https://t.co/hscxzsFxzY

Weather Update: We have closed the flood gates at Warkworth #Northumberland & will continue to monitor river levels across the North East region.  Our virtual incident team will decide to close any additional gates if the weather forecast suggests action is required #SafetyFirst https://t.co/5KIaUEc9TX

tweets.text: River Roding has burst its banks again at Wanstead Park @CoLEppingForest @ELondonGuardian @IlfordRecorder @wavidi @RedbridgeLive @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/9zOUVAmWyF

This winter our local floodplain has shown its value, storing floodwater from the Nene and releasing it slowly. In the summer it supports a variety of habitats including wonderful  species-rich grasslands. #WorldWetlandsDay2021 @Floodplainmead #wetlands https://t.co/daRdIiwqMu
Great to see that most of the water has now gone at #Purley. Down to two pumps now. Great progress by Maria and her team. https://t.co/wGmBUHiWMU

While the #flood warnings & alerts for #Retford #NorthNotts have now been removed our teams continued to work last night & today, pumping water away from properties to protect them from #flooding 

Keep up-to-date with the latest situation üëâ https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20

#FloodAware https://t.co/9W35nDiVmg
@buejoll It needs the sustained interest of @EnvAgency and a prosecution or two.

It's FebruaryüéâWe're looking forward to running 3 webinars for @dorsetprepared Resilience Event on 17th-18th in partnership with @EnvAgencySW. These FREE sessions are for Dorset's Flood Wardens and Community Emergency Volunteers. Booking links in the thread‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/6ArSKrvZKT

There are a significant number of #flood warnings across England due to heavy rain.  

Watch our video to know what to do in a flood and sign up for flood warnings in your area now: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ILEujXjdR9

Really proud of this large pond created near Keswick last year, providing both natural flood management and habitat benefits - island and clean gravels for nesting birds, plus wildflowers for pollinators. We aim to build 7 more this summer! #WorldWetlandsDay @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/yLFB61o38p

A landscape-scale project to address the impact of climate change and safeguard a much-loved amenity by returning a Devon estuary and flood plain to a more natural condition, has been given unanimous approval by East Devon District Council planning committee. [1/4] https://t.co/TDIZ5scjuD

urls.title: Three new board members appointed to the Environment Agency

tweets.text:
Environment Secretary George Eustice has appointed Dr Stewart Davies, Ines Faden da Silva, and Lilli Matson to the @EnvAgency Board.

Their knowledge and experience will be an asset as we all work together to improve and enhance the natural environment.

https://t.co/vL2U5msBLp

It's LGBT+ History Month! We're proud to support our LGBT+ staff.

Our @LGBTHM staff network will be running events on this year's theme of Mind, Body & Spirit to help staff remain connected, even when we can't celebrate in person like we did here in 2017.

#LGBTHM21 | #TeamEA https://t.co/OBRaadM0Nf

It's live! #Landscapes2Lifescapes online exhibition. Our team @SociologyLancs, flood geomorphologists @EEIatHull & @EnvAgency bringing our work on the physical & social effects of flooding together with the stories of flood affected residents of all ages. https://t.co/Odfh3rBn9O https://t.co/hFVBpG4OMF

Today, @TheFloodHub launches its Landscapes to Lifescapes exhibition. Put together by teams from @CUIDARProject, @eelatHull and @EnvAgency, the exhibition focuses on the the physical and social effects of flooding. View here: https://t.co/le93oGmuHO.

#Landscapes2Lifescapes. https://t.co/YrJSKVRtMq
@ourwestlancs https://t.co/H0zx58rhbq

tweets.text: Brearley Fields this morning, soon to be wetlands, I can‚Äôt wait üòä it definitely lends itself to a wetlands project After the deluge over the last few days it‚Äôs pretty full. Soon it will be attracting some wonderful wildlife @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE #wetlands #nature https://t.co/5jqIDArwrj

Brilliant example by @EnvAgencyYNE of using a tidal defence asset to exclude the tide to make room for incoming fluvial water reducing upstream river flooding.

This clever thinking shows how to make the most out of existing FCRM assets & perhaps better justify new ones. üìèüìêüåä https://t.co/cAbA0wufEc

Our teams are out in Church beck, Coniston #Cumbria removing these small trees that have fallen or are ready to fall into the watercourse. 

If the trees had fallen into the watercourse, they could have caused blockages and #flood risk. https://t.co/SnFt0g1qXM

Any idea what's happening at the end of the PC World drain where it exits into Holes Bay, a series of bunds have been layed across entrance. Has there been a pollution incident? @PooleHarbourC @BayHoles @harbourbirds
